target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Codebook.Definition: An opening expression that signals acceptance or positive acknowledgement before presenting substantive points.
Frames software quality as the final result or end state achieved, rather than the process used to get there.
Defines quality in terms of internal structural aspects, specifically the source code and the system’s design/architecture.
Specifies an external quality criterion where the software should be free of defects.
Specifies an external quality criterion where the software must meet end user requirements.
